summary: The document outlines the operational procedures for meetings of the Deutsche Bank Regional Management, detailing frequency, length, attendance, agenda setting, document submission, and minute-taking. It emphasizes the importance of timely distribution of meeting materials and the responsibilities of the Chairman and Secretary.
keyFacts: Meetings are to be held quarterly and can be called on an ad hoc basis.
Meetings should not exceed 2 hours in length.
Members are encouraged to attend at least two-thirds of the meetings in a calendar year.
The Chairman is responsible for setting the agenda and ensuring timely distribution of documents.
Minutes of the meetings must be taken and distributed within seven business days.
